statement:
A graph $ G $ contains $ K_5 $ or $ K_{3,3} $ as a minor iff it contains
$ K_5 $ or $ K_{3,3} $ as a . Where $ K_5$ is the complete graph of
order 5 and $ K_{3,3}$ is the complete bipartite graph of order 6.

Remark that this theorem shows that Wagner’s theorem and Kuratowski’s
theorem are equivalent.
names: equivalence between the minor and topological minor of $K_5$ or $K_{3,3}$
